-<dd><p>Bases: <code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">object</span></code></p>
-<p>Classifier for All-Positive Bags using Axis-Aligned Positive Region.</p>
-<p>This classifier assigns a positive label to bags that contain instances within a predefined
-axis-parallel rectangle (APR) defined by the minimum and maximum feature values of positive
-instances in the training set.</p>
-<section id="attributes">
-<h1>Attributes<a class="headerlink" href="#attributes" title="Link to this heading">#</a></h1>
-<dl class="simple">
-<dt>apr<span class="classifier">list</span></dt><dd><p>List containing the minimum and maximum feature values defining the APR.</p>
-</dd>
-</dl>
-</section>

-<p>Dietterich, Thomas G., Richard H. Lathrop, and Toms Lozano-Prez.
-Solving the multiple instance problem with axis-parallel rectangles.
-Artificial intelligence 89.1 (1997): 31-71.</p>

 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="miml.classifier.mi.apr_classifier.APRClassifier">
 <em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">miml.classifier.mi.apr_classifier.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">APRClassifier</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#miml.classifier.mi.apr_classifier.APRClassifier" title="Link to this definition">#</a></dt>
-<dd><p>Bases: <code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">object</span></code></p>
-<p>Approach is to construct an APR by starting with
-a single positive instance and growing the APR by expanding it to cover additional
-positive instances.
-We call it the iterated discrimination algorithm, and it has three basic procedures:
--Grow. An algorithm for growing an APR with tight bounds along a specified set
-of features.
--Discriminate. An algorithm for choosing a set of discriminating features by analyzing
-an APR.
--Expand. An algorithm for expanding the bounds of an APR to improve its generalization ability.</p>
+<dd><p>Classifier for All-Positive Bags using Axis-Aligned Positive Region.</p>
+<p>This classifier assigns a positive label to bags that contain instances within a predefined
+axis-parallel rectangle (APR) defined by the minimum and maximum feature values of positive
+instances in the training set.</p>

   ccllaassss miml.classifier.mi.apr_classifier.APRClassifier_#
-      Bases: object
-      Approach is to construct an APR by starting with a single positive
-      instance and growing the APR by expanding it to cover additional
-      positive instances. We call it the iterated discrimination algorithm,
-      and it has three basic procedures: -Grow. An algorithm for growing an APR
-      with tight bounds along a specified set of features. -Discriminate. An
-      algorithm for choosing a set of discriminating features by analyzing an

+<td><p>Transform the dataset to multilabel dataset converting each bag into a single instance being the value of each attribute the geometric center of the instances in the bag.</p></td>

-<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">miml.classifier.mi.apr_classifier.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">APRClassifier</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#miml.classifier.mi.apr_classifier.APRClassifier" title="Link to this definition">#</a></dt>
-<dd><p>Bases: <code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">object</span></code></p>
-<p>Approach is to construct an APR by starting with
-a single positive instance and growing the APR by expanding it to cover additional
-positive instances.
-We call it the iterated discrimination algorithm, and it has three basic procedures:
--Grow. An algorithm for growing an APR with tight bounds along a specified set
-of features.
--Discriminate. An algorithm for choosing a set of discriminating features by analyzing
-an APR.
--Expand. An algorithm for expanding the bounds of an APR to improve its generalization ability.</p>
